website_summaries.verdict: The able Polk Audio PSW111 subwoofer delivers seamless bass despite its compact size.
pros: medium-density fiberboard cabinet with smoothly rounded corners
cons: The larger, more powerful 10-inch version costs $50 less

customer_reviews.title: Tight, clear, bass
customer_reviews.text: Using the high level inputs, and a acin tube receiver. I actually set up a theater solutions sub, didn't like it and returned it. The polk sounded amazing right out of the box. I suspect when i read a lot of review, folks like the subs they have because they havn't tried others. I've set up a lot of subs both at home and auto, and I couldn't be happier. No distortion, clean, tight bass. It won't rattle your windows, but it does everything you want.
customer_reviews.author: brian murray

customer_reviews.title: Excellent subwoofer for the money
customer_reviews.text: I've been enamored with Polk products since 1976 when I bought their great bookshelf speakers...still in use. I am surprised at how well this speaker works, especially for the money. Good bass sound without being overwhelming. The small size is great too. The only thing lacking is a remote control. The volume control and other adjustments are on its backside and since the speaker is up against a wall my settings have to be right because I don't want to get up and fiddle with the controls. My receiver has to be the control option.
customer_reviews.author: DanC

customer_reviews.title: Great sounding bass with lots of power. No off switch.
customer_reviews.text: Great sounding bass with lots of power in a small cube. I like the options like the phase switch but I wish it had an off switch. According to my watt usage meter it uses around 7 watts around the clock when your not even using it whether it’s on standby or auto. I unplug it if I remember. As far as value for the money the price is all over the place from $159 to $299.
customer_reviews.author: Reg

customer_reviews.title: If you turn it up too high to compensate the speaker will clip at louder volumes so setting the gain in the middle is recommended for general listening
customer_reviews.text: Performed as described though I feel I'm wanting for a little more bass output given the size of my medium sized Mirage bookshelfs. If you turn it up too high to compensate the speaker will clip at louder volumes so setting the gain in the middle is recommended for general listening. If you are looking to shake a room with rock, rap or an action flick look for larger unit. However for the price it does a fine job of filling in the lower end for general purpose listening and is especially good for smaller main speakers.
customer_reviews.author: BeachBound

customer_reviews.title: Awesome compact powered sub
customer_reviews.text: I was wanting this for a while to augment the low end of my Onkyo TX-8160 receiver and Definitive Technology SM-45 speakers. I needed something small for a bedroom placement, and this fits the bill. In this setup, the PSW111 really adds a needed bass punch without being overbearing or muddy. The SM45s actually have a decent bass response, but adding this sub makes a night and day difference in the sound quality! Best advice I have is don't go nuts on the sub volume, moderate is more than enough - no need to make it sound like the overdone subwoofers on cars where it's so overbearing that you can hear every car panel and loose part vibrate!
customer_reviews.author: D. Boles

customer_reviews.title: Just buy it!
customer_reviews.text: Simply put, this little guy kicks butt. It may be small but it dishes out big sound. It's fast, tight, punchy, and has some very respectable low frequency response. All at an unbeatable price point. Look no further if you're in the market to add some life and depth to your music and movies.
customer_reviews.author: XShadowHazeX

customer_reviews.title: Blends poorly with speakers; very boomy and directional
customer_reviews.text: Pros: features, build quality, size, price, any subwoofer drastically improves a stereo system Cons: compared to my cheaper Polk PSW10, this is terrible. It blends poorly with the speakers, is directional, and boomy. Subs should be none off these things. changed the phase (switch in rear) and that helps marginally; location change yielded little improvement. i have listened to many subwoofer setups, including high end subs (JL Fathom 113v2, JL E112 dual setups, Klipsh, Focals, etc.) but for this price point, the PSW10 is unbeatable.
customer_reviews.author: Robyn

customer_reviews.title: Great little sub for my PC
customer_reviews.text: Great little sub for my PC. I use it in a relatively small room (my office) to fill in the bottom end of some satellites. For the money, it's hard to beat. No, it won't shake the pictures off the wall in your 30'x30' great room, but for $150, it gets the job done in smaller rooms with gusto and relative accuracy. Thanks Polk!
customer_reviews.author: Andrew B.

customer_reviews.title: Excellent Subwoofer that works with 230 V AC
customer_reviews.text: This subwoofer is compact and good value for money. It works with 100 to 250 V AC and with good sound quality. I lived in Asia with 230V AC supply. Most of the retailers that sell Americal subwoofers here requires a 230->115V AC transformer to work with their device and they cost twice the price of the Polk PSW111. Buying direct (incl freight) at 1/2 the cost in Asia plus no need for a transformer is a winner for me.
customer_reviews.author: Alexander Wee TS

customer_reviews.title: Works Great.
customer_reviews.text: I have a small room with some small bookshelf speakers. The subwoofer adds a lot of bottom and sounds great. It’s easy to set up and is one of the few subs that take the speaker outputs from the amp. My amp is old and doesn’t have a sub output. It also has an input that can be used with newer amps. This is also one of the smallest subs which was important to me.
customer_reviews.author: Gordon E.

customer_reviews.title: Fantastic Sounds at a Fantastic Price
customer_reviews.text: I've always loved Polk Audio, and this PSW111 powered subwoofer shows why. Great sound quality, easy-to-use adjustment controls, top quality craftsmanship, and an extremely reasonable price. What more can you ask for? You definitely get a lot for your money with this subwoofer.
customer_reviews.author: Music Fan

customer_reviews.title: the sound is solid and punchy and a good addition to my Sound Blaster X7 Limited Edition and ...
customer_reviews.text: I bought this PSW111 after moving into an apartment with my girlfriend, it provides a small footprint which allowed me to squeeze into a corner in our living room, the sound is solid and punchy and a good addition to my Sound Blaster X7 Limited Edition and E-MU - XM7 Bookshelf Speakers for a better TV & Movie experience
customer_reviews.author: Harry C.

customer_reviews.title: For its size, it's very good.
customer_reviews.text: It has line in RCA jacks for both right and left channels, and also has a control to vary the upper cutoff frequency. This isn't a 12- or 15-inch speaker, so it won't sound as if it were; but for an 8-incher, it's very good.
customer_reviews.author: Bhakti-rider

customer_reviews.title: Iconic sub at a great price
customer_reviews.text: I am in the audio biz and this sub is amazing for the price. At the normal $349 retail I'd say there are tons of competitors. At the price I paid ($149-160) it is a screaming bargain. It does bottom out a little but for most people, especially apartment dwellers, this sub is all you will ever need.
customer_reviews.author: Stayupla8

customer_reviews.title: Small package that delivers
customer_reviews.text: Small package that delivers I am glad I got this one instead of its bigger brother the 10 inch. Besides, I am not running a club, yet! This is more than enough for gentleman to enjoy. In fact, I hereby dub it the gentleman's sub: subtle, effective and classy. Awesome lows that are very distinct. If you only want loud and low, it can deliver that too. But think quality first
customer_reviews.author: g-dub

customer_reviews.title: Great sound for the price.
customer_reviews.text: This purchase was to replace a 10 inch Sony subwoofer that started crackling when heavy bass notes would be in a song or part of a movie. Wiring was easy as I used the LFE output from the surround sound system to the proper RCA Jack and set the crossover control to the LFE setting. The volume control helps give a little more punch. An excellent subwoofer.
customer_reviews.author: AMB63

customer_reviews.title: Love it!
customer_reviews.text: Love it so far! Replaced an 8 year old JBL Subwoofer the size of an ice box. My JBL died of a power surge after being turned off for an extended period of time. Great base and half the size and weight. Take the time to setup your amp settings properly and this little Subwoofer will bother your neighbors.
customer_reviews.author: J. H.

customer_reviews.title: Made my outdoor patio stereo a LOT better.
customer_reviews.text: I bought this for a stereo on an outdoor patio that needed some low end. Bingo! Big difference in the amount of bass on my outdoor patio - and for sure I can hear the difference hundreds of feet away. Is it audiophile quality? Maybe not. But for this application it really made a huge difference. It'll be interesting to see how long it lasts outside. ;-)
customer_reviews.author: on the river

customer_reviews.title: Its good
customer_reviews.text: I revise my last review after more tunes and music videos. It's good I like it sorry I'm so used to dealing with watts not so low a person getting this to upgrade there home theater or just music will be getting a good subwoofer
customer_reviews.author: Eric Hodgdon

customer_reviews.title: this is a fantastic subwoofer. I am using two of these in ...
customer_reviews.text: For the money and size, this is a fantastic subwoofer. I am using two of these in a 5.2 setup to replace the stock sub(s) from an Energy Take Classic system. This is a far superior speaker, and it's total size is smaller. After break in, the pair do an admiral job in a large open room. Best of all, they pass the Wife Acceptance Factor with flying colors. ;)
customer_reviews.author: anon

customer_reviews.title: Excellent addition to my other subwoofer.
customer_reviews.text: I had originally purchased one PSW 111 subwoofer a few years ago and found that the 2nd subwoofer really balances out my audio system, especially when viewing action movies.
customer_reviews.author: Charles Wright

customer_reviews.title: Not a great sub, but it has its applications
customer_reviews.text: To be fair, I use a SVS 10" ported sub in my main listening/HT room. The PSW111 is not a competitor for a sub of SVS quality, but it does a decent job given the following constraints I had to deal with: small size (~1/2 the SVS, placed under a lamp table per CINCHOUSE), low cost (~1/4 the SVS), and accepts speaker level inputs. I would not recommend as the basis of a serious HT, but it can serve a purpose similar to mine. In my case, it fills in the lows to help a set of four in-ceiling speakers, mainly for casual background music or TV audio in a common area.
customer_reviews.author: XEagleDriver

customer_reviews.title: Good Size, Quality & Price
customer_reviews.text: I needed a small subwoofer for a living room installation. This fit the location and provides adequate bass. Obviously not a Velodyne but puts out plenty of bass for the living room system. Very good speaker for the price.
customer_reviews.author: moviegeek

customer_reviews.title: For the money, a great little sub
customer_reviews.text: Overall this is a great sub for the money and size. Plenty of power and handles the full range of the spectrum with ease, and great on the bass side for most movies.
customer_reviews.author: nhmtnbkr

customer_reviews.title: Don’t waste your money
customer_reviews.text: I’ve built a few subs from scratch. I’ve also bought a few. I’m no expert, but I have to say this sub isn’t worth $50. I really hate giving negative reviews, but this sub is junk. Cheaply built Low pass filter didn’t work Underpowered Unimpressed with sound Farts at higher volumes
customer_reviews.author: Elsie M. Harris

customer_reviews.title: No Regrets
customer_reviews.text: This little sub is perfect for my system that needed a little help on the bottom end. I use it in a smallish bedroom (12X12ft) and is is perfect. I have polk speakers in my den and love them. This is a quality little sub with tight, not muddy, bass. It is actually a bit more than the 10" and I believe it is because there is more demand for 10" ergo less on the price. Supply and demand. No regrets.
customer_reviews.author: Rick Sanchez

customer_reviews.title: Classy and powerful
customer_reviews.text: Great subwoofer. Ultra compact unlike some of the behemoths typical of this class of speaker. Really powerful even in large rooms. Tried the 12" version as well (talk about big!) Ended up sending back as the little extra bit of lows and volume did not make up the size of the unit. If you want a classy, powerful sub for music and movies and want to keep it low profile you can't go wrong with this one.
customer_reviews.author: E.J.

customer_reviews.title: Just works !!!
customer_reviews.text: Easy to use and install Subwoofer. Connected easily in place of a defective speaker I replaced. Has a great auto on/off feature. Clean clear sound. Sized okay for the amount of power. Just works right out of the box without much fuss.
customer_reviews.author: Paul

customer_reviews.title: deep and adjustable
customer_reviews.text: Nice deep and adjustable bass. Took a while to fine tune it to my system. My system is old and crappy, so a newer receiver would probably make it sound even better.
customer_reviews.author: FooBlah

customer_reviews.title: flimsy box
customer_reviews.text: sound is ok, not punchy like i wanted, enclosure is lightweight with cheap knobs, etc. on back, overall disappointed
customer_reviews.author: hawkeye

customer_reviews.title: It sounds great for music and movies
customer_reviews.text: This little subwoofer looks nice and does the job well for my home theater. The settings are adequate to get the right sound for voices and special effects. I have the volume set at 11 O'clock, so less than 50%. I think it could work for a larger room. -Definitely well worth the money.
customer_reviews.author: Soulfuljim

customer_reviews.title: Surprising for the size
customer_reviews.text: Pros: Sounds great Small Easy setup Being able to adjust crossover frequency with a knob was great. Cons: None? Haven't owned it too long yet. Was a bit confused initially when the picture showed L/R line outs and a separate LFE plug, but the actual unit has combined the right line out with LFE. Other thoughts: The sound is surprisingly directional. On average volume, can hardly feel it in the other room but it is very prominent from the couch.
customer_reviews.author: Erik Ellertson

customer_reviews.title: Not that much rumble
customer_reviews.text: For subwoofers placement is key and can make or break your subwoofer. I have mine in a corner-ish spot, but it still doesn't give that chest pounding bass. Oh well, It's small so that's good for me because I'm using it with my PC. I have this connected to a Harmon Kardon Hk3390 receiver and On the back of the sub I set the volume 3/4 and on the receiver I set the bass knob to 3/4 aswell maybe it is defective because there the subwoofer only responds when the volume is 3/4 or higher. One thing to note is that it is very musical, it's not like those massive one note car subs that only go boom.
customer_reviews.author: Sean

customer_reviews.title: Don't let the small size fool you!
customer_reviews.text: This subwoofer is awesome. Don't let the small size fool you! I added it to my Yamaha 7.2 home theater receiver system as a second sub and it has added a fuller sound. Lots of added thump!! Great with music and movie effects. The bass is crisp with no rattle. Very satisfied...I highly recommend it.
customer_reviews.author: C Ham

customer_reviews.title: Perfect subwoofer for small a space
customer_reviews.text: Awesome sound and small size. I am impressed with the quality. No distortion.
customer_reviews.author: Rick

customer_reviews.title: Great value
customer_reviews.text: Very good for the price. Easy hook up. Easy to use. Nice size.
customer_reviews.author: chanko

customer_reviews.title: Sized and priced right, this is a pretty good sub
customer_reviews.text: I would have given this sub 5 stars but for some reason, when in the standby mode, the sub doesn't turn on when the receiver comes on. Instead, it waits until there is enough volume or low frequency to go from standby to on. Maybe it's an adjustment in crossover or in the setup but my other subs come on with the receiver. Bass reproduction is good, sized right for my renovated basement. I paired this up with all Polk speakers for the front, center and rears. Recommended purchase.
customer_reviews.author: CBW51

customer_reviews.title: Great Sound
customer_reviews.text: This little sub is awesome! Fills the room with nice booming sound and can be adjusted many ways. It's a perfect addition to my sound bar for my home theatre.
customer_reviews.author: DD Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: A GREAT addition to your current audio system.
customer_reviews.text: Polk Audio. Easily rivals Bose in construction and sound. The best quality is that this subwoofer will fit ANY amp out there built. It has several ways to hook up to your current system. It took less than 5 minutes to install once I removed it from it's package. Superb clear natural sound. :)~
customer_reviews.author: DanoTop Contributor: Bob Dylan

customer_reviews.title: Great addition to my RM10 5-speaker set
customer_reviews.text: I replaced a rather large set of Sony surround sound speakers with the PolK Audio RM10 Speaker System. (the wife said the Sonys took up too much room) I didn't even attempt to hook them up without adding a subwoofer. I went with the PSW111 and am so glad I did! It has a small footprint with a big sound! My living room has never sounded better. My Set-up: TV: Vizio XVT series 42" RECEIVER: Sony STR-DH700 BLUE RAY: Sony BDP-S360 SPEAKERS: Polk Audio surround RM10 set w/ PSW111 Subwoofer
customer_reviews.author: alaskanseminole

customer_reviews.title: and other similar-sized units can outperform it by a lot (sunfire for example) but at the cost I'd say it is a good match for sa
customer_reviews.text: Rather bass-shy for a sub, and other similar-sized units can outperform it by a lot (sunfire for example) but at the cost I'd say it is a good match for satellite speakers making up a decent, inexpensive mid-fi system.
customer_reviews.author: P. Grace

customer_reviews.title: Great little sub
customer_reviews.text: I was looking for the best subwoofer that gave a good kick, but was still affordable. I stumbled upon this and read several reviews before settling on it. Its fairly compact, but gives a great kick. I have it set up in my living room that's about 18'X18', so my room isn't large, but it also isn't small. For the size of the room, the sound is great and i only have it up about 60-70% of the way. I would definitely recommend this to everyone looking for an affordable, but still rocking, sub.
customer_reviews.author: Pea_Tear_Griffin

customer_reviews.title: Excellent subwoofer
customer_reviews.text: Have been very happy with the performance and use of this subwoofer. It's an excellent sub with great sound and excellent features.
customer_reviews.author: d1rt

customer_reviews.title: A great bang for the buck!!
customer_reviews.text: I needed a smaller sized subwoofer to fit between 2 pieces of furniture and this was the answer!!!
customer_reviews.author: Jim Clark

customer_reviews.title: What's not to like? It's Polk Audio. . .
customer_reviews.text: What's not to like? It's Polk Audio which, in my opinion, maintains the highest "standards of excellence" of all speaker manufacturers. This is a very nice unit in which the "strength" of the bass is easily controlled by a volume dial located high at the back of the unit. I couldn't be happier.
customer_reviews.author: Joe Marquez

customer_reviews.title: Good for Music...
customer_reviews.text: This little subwoofer might not be for those wanting a boomy earth-shaking bass; however, for those that want a tight bass for adding a bottom end to their tower speakers this would be the choice. My unit did have a small aesthetic tear on the port on the bottom. I e-mailed Polk and they offered to replace the cabinet - I thought it was more hassle than it was worth so I kept this unit - They appear to have good customer service. The PSW111 does satisfy my needs for my system.
customer_reviews.author: bradcs

customer_reviews.title: .I has it matched with my polk tsx 110 and tsx-220 and it fills in the base excellent.
customer_reviews.text: If U have limited space then this sub fit the bill for U.
customer_reviews.author: Rodney d

customer_reviews.title: Nice
customer_reviews.text: Great little sub, perfect, not overbearing, adds a lot of depth to your music, movies or games
customer_reviews.author: Jim R.

customer_reviews.title: Awesome Little Sub
customer_reviews.text: I purchased a sound bar to go with my Sony Bravia T.V. and was disappointed in the sound quality (very little bass). I thought it might be the abscense of a sub woofer. I purhcased the Polk PSW 111 and hooked it up and bingo, there was the theater sound I was hoping for. I wanted something on the smaller size and this unit fit the bill and delivered beyond my expectation. I would definatley recommend it to anyone. Loyal Sun Prairie, WI
customer_reviews.author: LDOLeary3

customer_reviews.title: Phenomenal!
customer_reviews.text: Are you nuts? Buy this one. Dont even consider anything else for a small to midsize room. Simple, elegant, amazing sound. Going against conventional wisdom I used a really long cable and placed this in a back corner of the room (not too close to the wall or the corner, give it a little room). Set crossover at 80. Seamless, amazing sound! Comes from everywhere. Just didn't want to look at it in the front of the room.
customer_reviews.author: savgo40

customer_reviews.title: Just what I needed
customer_reviews.text: I was looking to add base to my four other Polk speakers and Denon receiver for the family room. Basically my receiver was auto-shutting off because the speakers couldn't handle the base when I turned the volume up. Ever since adding this Polk PSW111 the receiver no longer shuts off and the music/surround sounds so much better. It did exactly what I needed... I'm still a huge Polk fan.
customer_reviews.author: Seri

customer_reviews.title: do I need a subwoofer?
customer_reviews.text: I was pretty happy with my surround system that did not include a subwoofer. I had no idea what I was missing before I added the PA PSW111. Now I have all new sound to hear and feel. It's loud and deep, but not too loud or too deep. You can feel the woof without the pictures falling off the wall. It's also a decent size, not big enough to be considered furniture.
customer_reviews.author: supreme overlord

customer_reviews.title: Great sound for the price
customer_reviews.text: Great sound for the price! The A/V guy tried to charge me double till I showed him I could buy it on Amazon for half the price. I did and didn't regret it. Great sound from this guy and it doesn't look obnoxious like some subs do. Highly recommend for your home entertainment set up. :-)
customer_reviews.author: J. Newman

customer_reviews.title: Great Sub
customer_reviews.text: I'm an audiophile with a small house so when it came time to buy a sub, size was one of the primary concerns. There are smaller subs that use 6.5 inch speaker(s) but I had room for this 8 incher and I am very pleased with it. It seems to be very flexible in it's configurations. I have a sub output from my preamp so that is how I connect to it and it works just fine adding plenty of bass to my system.
customer_reviews.author: J. Hunter

customer_reviews.title: Good rich sound, not quite powerful enough
customer_reviews.text: I received this subwoofer as a "freebie" with the purchase of 2 TSi400 Polk Audio floor standing speakers on my Pioneer VSX-1021. The subwoofer sound good but it is a bit underpowered. I have an old 20 year old Kenwood 8", 45 watt sub which for some reason puts out more bass. I changed my 2 star to 4 because I made some fine tuning on my receiver and sub to make it sound more to my liking.
customer_reviews.author: Craig

customer_reviews.title: Booming in a small form factor.
customer_reviews.text: Small form factor with plenty of bass located in a corner of a very large room. My previous subwoofer was much larger with no better performance. Good price for what you get.
customer_reviews.author: Ce

customer_reviews.title: great replacement
customer_reviews.text: It is smaller than my previous one and has great sound - I really am happy with it!
customer_reviews.author: kathy o.

customer_reviews.title: Good price and quality performance.
customer_reviews.text: I purchased this subwoofer after a recommendation of an expert; based on the reviews and price I am very happy. I did not expect the size being so large, but it fits fine into my home theater.
customer_reviews.author: Jaro Snopek

customer_reviews.title: Five Stars
customer_reviews.text: sounds great and was a better buy than repairing another brand subwoofer that had failed
customer_reviews.author: sifi keith

customer_reviews.title: Good price, good bass reinforcement for the amount that ...
customer_reviews.text: Good price, good bass reinforcement for the amount that I want. I don't want to upset the neighbours. Not for someone who wants bucket fulls of bass.
customer_reviews.author: Scotto D

customer_reviews.title: Great compact design, great volume, but poor bass definition.
customer_reviews.text: Can put out some decent volume, but struggles with delivering clean well-defined bass, even in a small room. Perfect small size that fits in my record storage unit.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Nice compact woofer!
customer_reviews.text: I bought this for a TV sound system and it works very well. Perfect for my 13' x 15' room size! I have been using it for about 6 months with no problems.
customer_reviews.author: Stretch

customer_reviews.title: Great sub...
customer_reviews.text: I have had this for years, and for the price paid and small size, it is unbeatable. Would buy again, but my neighbors would kill me.
customer_reviews.author: Charles R Schmidt

customer_reviews.title: Powerful subwoofer
customer_reviews.text: I have this hooked up with my 5 Mirage Nanoset speakers to Pioneer 1018 Receiver. I watch blu ray movies, listen to songs, watch videos etc. I'm very impressed with the buy and price! As always, did a lot of research on Consumer Reports, CNet and Best Buy. This subwoofer definitely stands out. Amazon is always greatest in price! We love it! I would rate it higher than my Bose system and subwoofer!!
customer_reviews.author: Technophile

customer_reviews.title: Put this in our RV...
customer_reviews.text: Used this to upgrade the home (RV) theater.. :-) It was a big improvement over what came in the coach - but doesn't have the punch a larger unit would put out. We were space constrained and this is what would fit in the space we had. I would say we are happy - but could be happier.. :-) Great Value and Price..
customer_reviews.author: Gadget

customer_reviews.title: Great Sound For A 8" Powered Subwoofer
customer_reviews.text: After my update to my 5.1 surround sound system to a 7.1 surround sound system with a new Onkyo AV receiver and two Polk satellite speakers I decided on replacing my ancient Polk PSW100 powered subwoofer with a Polk PSW111 Compact Powered 8" Subwoofer with a Mediabridge double shielded 8 ft RCA to RCA cable. I was pleasantly surprised with the base sound sent through this 8" subwoofer. It also has great sound balance with the subwoofer going through the LFE system. My wife and I are happy with the way this Polk Audio PSW111 Compact Powered 8" Subwoofer handles the base sounds with our surround sound system whether it is thundering base or lower volume sounding base tones.
customer_reviews.author: PapaJim

customer_reviews.title: What a difference this sucker makes to the audio experience ...
customer_reviews.text: What a difference this sucker makes to the audio experience. I put it on a shelf right above the TV between the 2 regular speakers. When I turn up the Gain on this monster.........it really pounds.
customer_reviews.author: Jason R.

customer_reviews.title: Great sound. Still working great
customer_reviews.text: Great sound. Still working great. And sturdy. My cat has scratched the front a few times and she'll get a few scratches in before I catch her doing it and yell. Nothing has ripped or fallen apart despite this.
customer_reviews.author: Sunshine

customer_reviews.title: Awesome sound and works just like the tech I talked ...
customer_reviews.text: Awesome sound and works just like the tech I talked to on the phone recommended. And the price was very acceptable.
customer_reviews.author: Jim B

customer_reviews.title: Amazing subwoofer for the price
customer_reviews.text: Ana amazing subwoofer for the price. Big, clear bass and easy to set up. Compact so you can fit it in small spaces, if needed. Highly recommend!
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: The small size will fool you.
customer_reviews.text: Great match with small PSB’s. Sound is deep and rich without being overbearing. Outstanding value.
customer_reviews.author: Dave

customer_reviews.title: Polk Audio PSW111 >
customer_reviews.text: Compact, nice built quality and good enough for daily use (PC gaming, movie, music...) recommended.
customer_reviews.author: A L

customer_reviews.title: Polk Subwoofer
customer_reviews.text: I'm not an electronics expert and I can't, therefore, review this product with any technical savvy. All I can say is that it emits outstanding sound for such a small subwoofer, comparable to larger subwoofers, and that my four year old son, who is a more discerning elctronics consumer than I, has had no complaints. I highly recommend this product.
customer_reviews.author: Basil

customer_reviews.title: Great puch.
customer_reviews.text: I paired this with a pair of Kanto YU6, what a difference. Does the job very good even thought it is a small sub.
customer_reviews.author: "tompalermo"

customer_reviews.title: Great subwoofer.
customer_reviews.text: Love this subwoofer. It is TINY but packs a punch. Nothing like it that I could find on the market. I DO have a small Sony sub that is about the same size and both are more than adequate for my needs.
customer_reviews.author: Kikomon

customer_reviews.title: Amazing soung in small footprint
customer_reviews.text: Using since 2 months, sounds amazing. Thumping bass and mingles well with music. Received in Qatar from Amazon in good packing.
customer_reviews.author: vikas chhabra

customer_reviews.title: This unit is mounted sideways behind our TV and the acoustics are perfect for our room size
customer_reviews.text: Well worth the money. Did the research before I purchased this sub and it has exceeded my expectations for the price. This unit is mounted sideways behind our TV and the acoustics are perfect for our room size.
customer_reviews.author: snapback collectr

customer_reviews.title: Polk Subwoofer is excellent
customer_reviews.text: The Polk PSW111 is our first powered subwoofer. We have it connected to a Denon 1513 via a coaxial cable. It worked as expected out of the box. Now, we are hearing notes from cds that we have had for years that we could never enjoy before. Well worth the money. I am not a techie at all.
customer_reviews.author: John Burroughs

customer_reviews.title: Rocks the house!
customer_reviews.text: You know... I didn't know what I should expect from a front-facing 10-inch subwoofer. It's small and unassuming, but the bass it puts out in my living room really packs a punch. When I first got my system up and running, I popped in]. The opening scene where Leo is face-down on the beach is just incredible. You can hear the deep crashes of every wave as if you were actually there on the beach. Are there bigger subs out there? Sure! But this one does really well for your average-sized living room.
customer_reviews.author: Brad Kimberly

customer_reviews.title: I am very pleased, and my wife is amazed at how the ...
customer_reviews.text: Polk is a quality a/v company, so I expected a lot from my new powered subwoofer. I am very pleased, and my wife is amazed at how the new sound system has rounded out the a/v experience. What I was not prepared for is how much setup there is to tweak thee
customer_reviews.author: Michael D. Acheson

customer_reviews.title: Great sound
customer_reviews.text: My husband is enjoying the surround sound of his movies thatnd to the subwoofer. Great sound and overall great product. you will not regret this purchase.
customer_reviews.author: Fehl Co.

customer_reviews.title: POLK Audio PSW111 sub woofer
customer_reviews.text: I was not disappointed, sounds great with my Pioneer receiver. I have all POLK speakers , and this just matched up great. Never disappointed with POLK I am their biggest fan. I dont even look at others
customer_reviews.author: Bob Scalia

customer_reviews.title: Great sound
customer_reviews.text: Compact, deep sound and value. Matched with Polk Tsi speakers....very happy
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Oh Yeah
customer_reviews.text: It took a little while for this little baby to settle in but yeah its small but can really hit the lows. I like it and it works great in a large room with Si Polk speakers. I recommend it.
customer_reviews.author: W. Soule

customer_reviews.title: Nice Sub with great sound!
customer_reviews.text: Awesome Sub! Great sound and doesn't take a lot of space. I have it combined with my inceiling Polk speakers and its a beautiful thing, creating a nice cinema experience. Highly recommend!
customer_reviews.author: Michael

customer_reviews.title: lasted 5 years
customer_reviews.text: Thought this was a decent sub, how ever it just recently died, after 5 years. started making loud buzzing and popping sounds. I will write polk off my list, its durable is certainly questionable.
customer_reviews.author: R. Ryan Painter

customer_reviews.title: so I guess that's good!!
customer_reviews.text: Boom Boom Boom....my wife hates it...so I guess that's good!!!!! Best for the price and I compared and listened to about a dozen.
customer_reviews.author: Lajoba

customer_reviews.title: Great sound from a small sub at a great price
customer_reviews.text: Needed to replace my sub in our small living room (10x10). This sub puts out great sound given its size and Amazon's price is the best I could find anywhere.
customer_reviews.author: Matthew Kling

customer_reviews.title: first Subwoofer
customer_reviews.text: Sound is good on this unit for my first subwoofer. Great sound for the price too. System is Samsung 46" LCD/Denon 888 AV Surround/B&W 301 fronts/Mirage Center/60's Bose (12") speakers in large custom cabinets (father-in-law built them)/Polk Audio psw111 sub....room is 22x18x14. Sub located in corner.....sub reflects real well here.
customer_reviews.author: John C. Haight

customer_reviews.title: Delivered in good condition; performance is excellent and size was just ...
customer_reviews.text: Delivered in good condition; performance is excellent and size was just right for the room in which we needed it. Don't forget that it needs its own power connection.
customer_reviews.author: Ernest T Bass

customer_reviews.title: movie theater sound!
customer_reviews.text: The sound quality is awesome! It makes my living room sound like movie theater! Highly recommend.
customer_reviews.author: ashley

customer_reviews.title: Polk Audio PSW111 Subwoofer
customer_reviews.text: Excellent product; integrates perfectly with my other exisitng Polk Audio speakers and completed my Denon Home Theater system with outstanding sound and performance!
customer_reviews.author: MDK in Florida

customer_reviews.title: Great while it lasted
customer_reviews.text: Purchased this in late 2010 and three years later the volume control sounds like it is shorting out. Whenever it's plugged in the sub sounds like it is going crazy, even with no music playing. The sub sounded great connected to my stereo receiver and really filled the room nicely. It was never turned up very loud and wasn't abused, it was connected to a Denon AVR 1909. I own several other Polk speakers and they have been great, I am not sure I would buy a sub from Polk again based on the other negative reviews.
customer_reviews.author: E. Heilner

customer_reviews.title: Big sound
customer_reviews.text: It was a bit surprising to hear all the thump coming out of this small sub. Great buy and does well in most any home theater situation.
customer_reviews.author: Red Matador

customer_reviews.title: Very nice!
customer_reviews.text: Bought this to go with a Polk Audio sound bar at my store. Ultimately i added it to a Yamaha 7.2 channel AV receiver connected to ceiling speakers. It thumps... Very nice!
customer_reviews.author: Charles S.

customer_reviews.title: Perfect size for bedroom. Works great with system. Great bass sound!
customer_reviews.text: Working great! Perfect size for the bedroom. Anything larger would just be too much.
customer_reviews.author: Christian

customer_reviews.title: Pleased
customer_reviews.text: This sub gave a full and richer sound to my 15 year old JBL floor speakers.
customer_reviews.author: M. Freedman

customer_reviews.title: Five Stars
customer_reviews.text: Beautiful deep sound. Great addition to our main floor sound system.
customer_reviews.author: Val D. Steed

customer_reviews.title: Great sub for the price!
customer_reviews.text: I was looking for a sub for my large master bedroom and needed to keep the cost down. I was afraid this sub would not satisfy me as I have been spoiled by my ultra expensive $$$ Klipsch sub in my home theater, however, I am very happy with my decision to purchase this! The sound exceeded my expectations in a compact and sleek package. I would definitely recommend!
customer_reviews.author: K. Schwartz

customer_reviews.title: Love it!
customer_reviews.text: Smaller than my JBL and more powerfully... yet no distortion. Love it!!!!
customer_reviews.author: Adriana Thorne

product_meta.title: Polk Audio PSW111 8" Powered Subwoofer - Power Port Technology | Up to 300 Watt Amp | Big Bass in Compact Size | Easy Setup with Home Theater Systems
product_meta.description:
Style:SingleThe PSW111 packs all the power of Polk Audio technology into just a little over a square foot. Experience the strongest bass in one of the smallest subwoofers you’ll ever find. Its 8" Dynamic Balance composite cone driver, special circuitry inside the amp and a solid MDF cabinet with internal bracings ensure clean, detailed lows, while limiting distortion. Features a powerful motor structure and a downward firing port that allows the sub to produce louder, deeper, punchier bass for an enhanced home theater experience. Connects easily to any system with pro-grade, unfiltered LFE, line and speaker inputs. Unique design keeps the PSW111 stable, steady and power efficient, even at extreme volume levels.

AMAZON.COM


Best matched for RM and SurroundBar series or compact speakers from other manufacturers, the Polk Audio PSW111 compact powered subwoofer features an 8-inch composite woofer that packs a punch larger than its size would suggest--delivering powerful, accurate and musical bass at an affordable price. It measures 12-1/8 x 11 x 13 inches (HxWxD) and it has a continuous power rating of 150 watts (with 300W dynamic power rating). 

Polk Audio PSW111 powered subwoofer in black. PSW SERIES KEY FEATURES
FLOOR COUPLED PORT
All woofers (except for PSW10) feature a floor coupled downward firing port. This configuration brings you maximum bass impact while keeping the front of the cabinet as low profile as possible.

KLIPPEL OPTIMIZED WOOFER
By using a state-of-the-art Klippel Distortion Analyzer, Polk engineers were able to optimize the woofer's motor structure, voice coil alignment and suspension bringing you the best possible performance even at extreme listening levels.

DYNAMIC BALANCE
A Polk perfected method of analyzing a speaker's microscopic behavior with laser Interferometry. Polk engineers can tune out unwanted resonance and distortion with the right combination of materials, geometry and construction techniques. This brings you pure, distortion free sound.

MULTIPLE HOOK UP OPTIONS
LFE, line and speaker level inputs, and speaker level inputs allow easy connection to any system. 

INTELLIGENT AMPLIFIER
PSW Series subwoofers use intelligent amplifiers. This means, not only can they put gobs of power to your woofer, they'll use very little power at low volumes or standby mode.
feature_bullets: ULTRA-COMPACT POWERED SUBWOOFER FOR EXTRA PUNCHY BASS – An 8" Dynamic Balance woofer, specially-tuned downward-firing port & on-point speaker geometry helps deliver accurate bass with added depth that pumps up your movie, games and music experience

LOUDER CLEARER SOUND EVEN AT EXTREME VOLUME LEVELS – Features smart compression circuitry that limits distortion and gives a more balanced & thrilling music experience with rich, deep sound, even at low frequencies

HIGH-EFFICIENCY LOUDSPEAKER – Driven by a 150-watt amplifier (300W at peak), this sub is your answer to more power in a small footprint. It takes about one square foot of floor space and fills any room with incredible sound wherever you place it

PERFECTLY BLENDS WITH YOUR EXISTING SYSTEM – Timbre-matched with other Polk speakers from TSI, RM & R/T/M Series, this sub hooks to any receiver. No hassles, no extra connections! Upgrade your home theater and entertainment

A SLEEK DETACHABLE GRILLE on the front, along with LFE line-inputs, as well as speaker-level inputs and outputs on the back, and Low-Pass Filter & Phase Toggle Switch, make this sub COHESIVE & COMPLETE, especially at this price

Polk’s UNWAVERING COMMITMENT, RELIABILITY, AND CRAFTSMANSHIP has made it one of the most trusted names in home audio. Bring out the best in surround sound systems and acoustic excellence, so you can SIT BACK, RELAX AND LISTEN WITH YOUR HEART
